author: Tara Suter
description: Activist David Hogg blasted the Democratic National Committee (DNC) on Thursday for choosing to not release its postmortem of Democrats’ 2024 election losses. “I ran for DNC vice chair after massive losses in 2024 because I believed we needed to change our party,” Hogg said in a post on the social platform X. “Leadership disagreed…
title: Hogg slams DNC over not releasing 2024 analysis

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Members of the Kennedy family publicly rebuked the decision to rename the Kennedy Center — a living tribute to former President John F. Kennedy — as the Trump-Kennedy Center. The center’s board — whose members President Trump hand-selected earlier this year —voted unanimously on Thursday to rename the building to honor both U.S. presidents, drawing…
title: Kennedy family members slam move to rename Kennedy Center

author: Max Rego
description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) charged more individuals as part of its ongoing and expanding probe into fraud in Minnesota on Thursday. Joseph Thompson, the assistant U.S. attorney for Minnesota, announced charges against individuals accused of defrauding the state’s Housing Stabilization Services (HSS) and Early Intensive Developmental and Behavioral Intervention (EIDBI) programs, which offer Medicaid-funded…
title: DOJ charges six more in growing Minnesota fraud scandal

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. Richard Hudson (R-N.C.) on Thursday mourned the loss of famed NASCAR driver Greg Biffle and his family after they died in a jet crash. “I am devastated by the loss of Greg, Cristina, and their children, and my heart is with all who loved them,” Hudson wrote in a post on the social platform…
title: NC rep ‘devastated’ by deaths of NASCAR driver Greg Biffle, family

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Michele Morrow, who was the Republican nominee for North Carolina Superintendent of Public Instruction last cycle, is challenging former Republican National Committee (RNC) Chair Michael Whatley for the state’s open Senate seat next year. “[North Carolina] cannot afford four more years of Roy Cooper,” Morrow said in a statement upon announcing her candidacy.  “I plan…
title: Former GOP candidate for NC schools enters Senate primary against Whatley

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) slammed President Trump’s Wednesday national address as a deflection from rising health care costs and grocery bills. “All those words when he could’ve just said: f— your health care and your grocery bills. Get a third job, peasant,” Newsom’s press office wrote in a Wednesday night post on the social…
title: Newsom summarizes Trump speech: ‘F— your health care and your grocery bills’

author: Julia Shapero
description: Several leading cryptocurrency companies and trade groups urged lawmakers on the Senate Banking Committee on Thursday to reject efforts to add new limits on stablecoin rewards in upcoming legislation.  In a letter led by the Blockchain Association, more than 125 crypto industry players argued against a push to “reinterpret and expand” an existing prohibition on stablecoin interest in the GENIUS Act.   Among the signatories are the Bitcoin Policy Institute, Crypto…
title: Crypto industry presses Senate Banking panel to reject efforts to expand limits on stablecoin rewards

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy’s daughter called the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) “unconstitutional” after undergoing what she described as an “absurdly invasive” pat-down at airport security. In a post Thursday on the social platform X, Evita Duffy-Alfonso detailed her challenging experience as a pregnant woman wanting to avoid the radiation exposure from the full-body scanner at…
title: Sean Duffy’s daughter calls out TSA as ‘unconstitutional’ after pat-down

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: A moratorium on all new data centers! Holy escalation, Batman!
title: Bernie Sanders demands AI data center moratorium

author: Max Rego
description: Miami Mayor-elect Eileen Higgins (D) in a Wednesday evening interview on NewsNation slammed the Trump administration over immigration enforcement. “Just stop it,” Higgins told host Chris Cuomo. “It’s bad for our economy, it’s horrifying for our families, and we cannot proceed this way as a nation.” Since President Trump returned to office, the Department of…
title: Miami mayor-elect Eileen Higgins on immigration enforcement: ‘We cannot proceed this way as a nation’

author: Tara Suter
description: A little less than half of registered voters believe President Trump should pay more attention to high prices, according to a new Fox News poll. When asked to pick a single issue from a list that Trump ought to “be paying MORE attention to right now,” 42 percent of respondents said “high prices,” with “health…
title: 42 percent in Fox News poll say Trump should pay more attention to high prices

author: Julia Shapero
description: Two families are suing Meta over their sons’ suicides, accusing the tech giant of failing to implement safeguards to prevent the sextortion schemes that drove their teens to take their own lives.  Tricia Maciejewski and Rosalind and Mark Downey filed a wrongful death lawsuit against the Facebook and Instagram parent company Wednesday.  They allege the deaths of their sons “were the foreseeable result of Meta’s design decisions and…
title: Meta sued over teens’ suicides

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Los Angeles Rams wide receiver Puka Nacua is facing blowback for an appearance he made on a livestream this week during which he promised a pair of internet personalities he would do a touchdown dance widely viewed as having antisemitic undertones. During the stream with influencers Adin Ross and N3on, the football player chatted with…
title: LA Rams star Puka Nacua under fire over ‘antisemitic touchdown dance’ promise

author: Mike Lillis
description: Top House Democrats on Thursday called on Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) to hold an immediate vote on extending the enhanced Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies set to expire at the end of the year. The Democrats succeeded this week in forcing a vote on a three-year extension of the ObamaCare tax credits when four centrist…
title: Jeffries, Democrats press Johnson for immediate vote on ObamaCare subsidies

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Vanity Fair photographer Christopher Anderson on Wednesday defended his photos of White House aides taken for a profile on chief of staff Susie Wiles, after both the story and his images were met with criticism from Trump administration officials and allies. “It is curious that the internet is shocked that I would not retouch the…
title: Vanity Fair photographer defends close-up pictures of Trump aides in Wiles profile

author: Tara Suter
description: Alan Dershowitz, the former lawyer of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, said he told President Trump it’s “not clear” whether it would be constitutional for him to serve a third term in the White House. Dershowitz, in an interview with The Wall Street Journal, said he gave Trump a draft copy of his upcoming book…
title: Dershowitz says he told Trump constitutionality of third term ‘not clear’

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: House Democrats on the Homeland Security Committee are asking a government watchdog to undertake a review of the Trump administration’s hiring practices, citing issues with trainees as they dramatically ramp up recruitment of immigration enforcement agents. The Trump administration in August ended age limits for those interested in serving as U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officers,…
title: Democrats ask federal watchdog to review ICE hiring surge amid reports of issues with trainees

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Hospitals and doctors that perform gender-affirming care surgery on minors will have to forgo federal Medicare and Medicaid funding under new rules proposed by the Trump administration Thursday, even in states where the procedures are legal.  The multi-pronged plan from the Department of Health and Human Services is part of the administration’s efforts to curtail gender-affirming care, and if made final, could essentially ban the practice nationwide.  “The Trump administration will not stand by while…
title: Trump administration seeks to effectively end gender-affirming care for minors

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. Kevin Kiley (R-Calif.) wants House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) to chart a different course in 2026. “I hope that the Speaker takes a different approach in the new year, where the House can sort of put itself back in the driver’s seat when it comes to the issues that really matter to folks,” Kiley…
title: GOP lawmaker: ‘I hope that the Speaker takes a different approach in the new year’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump announced Wednesday night that military service members will receive checks for $1,776, a nod to the nation’s founding year. The news came during the president’s national address, which focused on affordability and served as a wrap-up for the first year of his second term in office. “Because of tariffs, along with the just…
title: What to know about Trump’s $1,776 ‘warrior dividend’ to service members

author: Jess Conard, opinion contributor
description: Over 80 million Americans are just like me; they live near a Class I railroad track.
title: Without railway reform, your town could be the next East Palestine

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: A federal judge reversed the terminations of hundreds of government employees Wednesday, ruling that the Trump administration likely violated the terms of the funding deal that ended the longest-ever government shutdown.  That deal prohibits agencies from carrying out a reduction in force (RIF) until Jan. 30.  The Trump administration asserted that RIFs announced prior to the shutdown could still move ahead, but U.S. District Judge Susan Illston rejected…
title: Judge rules layoffs likely violated shutdown funding deal

author: The Hill Staff
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. delivered remarks Thursday on new federal guidance related to health care for minors. The remarks came after the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) unveiled a draft rule that would pause federal funding for hospitals that provide gender-affirming care for minors. Kennedy is expected to…
title: Watch: RFK Jr. gives remarks on updated guidance for youth health care

author: Don Wolfensberger, opinion contributor
description: The President has appealed to the Supreme Court to uphold his authority to set tariff rates, while Congress has been happy to delegate tariff questions to the executive branch, and the court is expected to hand down its decision in early January.
title: Trump pressures high court on pending tariff ruling

author: Tara Suter
description: The Trump administration has announced the sale of over $10 billion in weapons to Taiwan, a move likely to upset China. Among the weapons in the sale are medium-range missiles, drones and howitzers, The Associated Press reported. The package, if approved by Congress, will be the largest agreement with the U.S. ally, though Taiwan is…
title: Trump administration announces sale of $10 billion in weapons to Taiwan

author: Bryan Rotella, opinion contributor
description: Most Americans trust things they do not fully understand every day.  They trust traffic lights. Crosswalks. Driver’s education. The rules are visible; the expectations are shared. Trust follows.  That was not always true.  In the early 1900s, American streets were chaos. Automobiles were hailed as the future, but they arrived faster than society could prepare for them.…
title: Rules of the road: Why Trump’s AI order matters more than most Americans realize

author: The Hill Staff
description: A group of House Democrats will speak with reporters Thursday morning in opposition to the Trump administration’s deportation agenda, including the use of local law enforcement to assist with President Trump’s crackdown on immigration. During the press conference, Reps. Mike Quigley (Ill.), Pramila Jayapal (Wash.), Sarah McBride (Del.) and Valerie Foushee (N.C.) are also expected…
title: Watch live: House Democrats speak out against use of police in immigration enforcement

author: Tara Suter
description: The Top Democrats in Congress took a swing at President Trump’s address from the White House late Wednesday, calling the speech “untethered from reality and truth.” “It was an unhinged speech that was, of course, untethered from reality and truth. You know, Donald Trump has made things worse for the American people,” Jeffries told MS NOW’s…
title: Top Democrats rip Trump address:  ‘Untethered from reality and truth’

author: Larry Miller, opinion contributor
description: While headlines focus on corporate "villains,” the real culprit is hiding in plain sight: scalpers that dominate the resale market.
title: The real villains behind high ticket prices

author: Joseph Choi
description: Moderna announced Thursday it will receive up to $54.3 million from a global vaccine partnership to fund its ongoing research into a potential bird flu mRNA vaccine, helping to recover some of the funding that was cut off when the federal government cancelled hundreds of millions in contracts. The Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI),…
title: Moderna receives $54.3M investment for bird flu vaccine, covering axed federal mRNA contracts

author: Mark Toth and Jonathan Sweet, opinion contributors
description: NATO is the defining legacy of our Greatest Generation.
title: Trump’s team risks undermining NATO, the Greatest Generation’s legacy

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The United States admitted fault for a January midair collision that killed 67 people in a Wednesday filing that said it breached its “duty of care” for passengers. An American Airlines flight and Army helicopter collided near Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport earlier this year.  The commercial flight was en route to Washington, D.C., from…
title: US admits fault in deadly midair collision near National Airport: ‘An accident waiting to happen’
